creator: i_bakalov@yahoo.com
text:
I suggest that the default character encoding should be set as variable (may be 
in the server.xml configuration file) rather than being hard-coded in the 
source of the connector (in fact it is hard-coded in catalina source if you are 
using the old connector), and the catalina server itself. I am using Tomcat for 
a long time (may be 2 years) and this problem exists from the early versions. 
When I am setting up a new version I always have to modify the code and to set 
the encoding to a cyrillic one like "windows-1251". Otherwise the url-decoding 
is not done properly and the cyrillic words that I send in a request appear 
corrupted.

creator: william.barker@wilshire.com
text:
This would violate the Servlet/JSP spec (which requires iso-latin-1 unless 
otherwise specified).  But, since it is an enhancement, I won't do the knee-
jerk "WONTFIX" on it.  It would be a totally Tomcat-specific and totally non-
portable feature however.

As an alternative, it seems to me that this should be easy enough to do in a 
Filter.

creator: funkman@joedog.org
text:
Since this can be fixed by a user written filter, and there hasn't been activity
on this request (an enhancement) for over 1 year - there isn't enough interest
in this or people have already worked around the problem themselves.
